title: Major reforms to Jersey's taxi industry
text:
Credit: Henning Kaiser / DPA/Press Association Images The Channel Islands Competition and Regulatory Authority claim reforms to taxi laws in Jersey are not in the best interests of consumers.
They say the laws will significantly increase the cost to taxi companies, which will be passed on to consumers.
CICRA exist to make sure consumers get the best value for high quality services, as well as promoting competition.
Their views on the reforms were made known to the Transport and Technical Services throughout the whole five years they were planned, they claim.
We are concerned that the reforms that the department is seeking to introduce retains a two-tier system which is confusing for consumers, will significantly increase the cost to industry of providing services (costs which will ultimately be borne by customers) and appear to increase the burden of regulation on the industry (with associated costs) without a clear case for such interventions.
